data.title: Rockford City Market (Fridays) — Rockford City Market
data.text:
Meet us at the Market!

Our 2024 Season runs every Friday, May 17 - September 27. We’re open 4:00pm - 8:30pm (7:30pm after Labor Day)

This FREE rain or shine Market is located in the heart of downtown Rockford, IL. Find us every Friday night in the summer underneath the Rockford City Market pavilion and on the surround streets — 100 N. Water St., Rockford IL.

Parking

There are many free & convenient parking options downtown. Check out our map below for some options!

Boat Parking: Summertime boating enthusiasts can arrive at Rockford City Market in style. Dock your boat at one of the several downtown docking areas and come on down.

Bike Parking: There is a bike rack on the North side of the Waterside Building at 124 N. Water Street as well as the south end of the pavilion parking lot close to East State Street.

Take the FREE Trolley

Rockford Mass Transit District will provide free trolley service between the Museum Campus, Davis Park, UW Health Sports Factory, Nicholas Conservatory and Rockford City Market (with additional stops at the Coronado Theatre, Nordlof Center, and more.) The trolley will run from 3:30 - 10:30pm.

Take the Bus

Public transportation using the Rockford Mass Transit District bus system is the perfect "go green" option for visiting Rockford City Market. The Market is on the #11 East State Street Route and will pick up and drop off at State and Water Streets every half hour at 20 after and at the top of the hour.

For more information on RMTD's bus routes, visit www.rmtd.org.

2024 MAin Stage Music schedule

About the Market:

The Outdoor Rockford City Market began in May of 2010 under the planning, leadership, and guidance of the local non-profit, the Rock River Development Partnership. Since then, the Market has grown substantially over the years and we feel continually blessed by the community’s support, loyalty, and love.

In the past 10 years we’ve grown from a handful of vendors in an empty parking lot, to 70+ vendors underneath the beautifully constructed pavilion downtown.
